raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Gastric adenocarcinoma", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Epithelial tumors arise from epithelial cells. Gastric adenocarcinoma is a malignant epithelial tumor originating from the gastric mucosa epithelium and represents ~90-95% of gastric cancers. Carcinoid tumors are neuroendocrine tumors (not epithelial origin), lymphomas are lymphoid/hematopoietic tumors, and GIST (gastrointestinal stromal tumors) are mesenchymal tumors arising from interstitial cells of Cajal. Only gastric adenocarcinoma is truly epithelial in origin.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
